content.description: This American Life is one of the classics on the wall. It takes the left hand side of the biggest bulge section, just right of No News is Good News. Start with a left hand crimpy fingerbucket sidepullish hold, and a slopey fingerstack pocket or high gaston with the right. Get the feet up high and punch straight up to sloper crimp, below the left facing pocket jug which is shaped like a "J". From the "J" jug go straight up past a pinch and slopey crimp to the the top. The first moves are long.

Pretty darn classic with a wild dyno. Just right of This American Life, on the right side of the prominent bulge. Start with the right hand on a good slopey pocket sidepull, left with whatever you want I suppose. Move up big to a left sidepull ripple crimp dealio just over the lip (kind of a big move). Then dyno up to the obvious jugs with either hand depending on what feels good. (IF SPOTTING BE PREPARED TO GET KICKED IN THE FACE) From the jugs go straight up to a cool side pull pocket and a somewhat hidden good two finger pocket. Up to the top from there with one last big move.
content.protection: Pads, spotter or two, face mask.

content.description: Just a hop left of the NPR Wall is a jutting line, riddled with good holds.
content.location: Just left of The NPR Wall

content.description: No News is Good News starts on the slopey pocket jug on the seam right of Morning Edition.  From that hold work your way up to a slopey crimp rail.  From there, move up to a sharp vertical pocket pinch.  Always moving up and slightly right, with an insecure heal hook move up into a tight two finger with the right, and slopey butter dish just aside the pocket...  These holds are very close together and constitute a match really. Up to the top from there.  Very cool moves on this one.  Kinda tricky until you commit to the heal hook.

Morning Edition starts left of an obvious seam with a big slopey pocket. Climb bulge trending up and left past a good edge pinch moving towards a very visible, vertically aligned finger lock pocket after the crux which helps identify the line.
content.location: Middle of the NPR wall, above old stump

content.description: On the far left side of the wall locate a large protruding jug feature. Launch upwards to more awesome holds.

All Things Considered starts to the right of the tree, and right of the seam/crackesque line.  I usually just start at the large, round, shallow pocket with crimps at the bottom of it.  Work your way up and right onto obvious jugs and then straight up past fingerlock pockets and more jugs. Good movement.
content.location: NPR wall, right side of tree.

pathTokens: Land of High Bouldering AKA The Ridge

content.description: The NPR wall brings out some of the best limestone bouldering that Lake Mary has to offer at moderate to harder grades. There are about 15 or so problems on the wall ranging from V-easy to V5-6ish. vertical sections to quality dramatic bulges will surely please just about anyone who checks it out. Landings are good to as good as it gets here.
